Charlie Wilson.Action: Humors Paul Brown despite knowing he is not a real player, to support Liz's enjoyment.
Admits he doesn't know how something works but is willing to listen to others who do.
Spends time in a hot tub with strippers and indulges in drugs, seemingly distracted from serious matters.
Interrupts a serious meeting with off-topic, joking remarks about Dan Rather's attire and TV volume, showing a casual, somewhat irreverent attitude.
Politely asks a guy to turn up the TV volume despite the guy being high, showing patience and courteousness.
Distracts from the meeting by focusing on trivial details like Dan Rather's attire and TV volume instead of the pitch being presented.
Attempts to get the TV volume turned up despite the guy being high, showing persistence in small tasks.

Confidently reveals his identity as a U.S. Congressman in an informal setting, engaging openly with strangers.
